user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_run:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_run (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
  if ( (daemon->shutdown) ||
       MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon) )
    return MHD_NO;

  (void) MHD_run_wait (daemon, 0);
  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if ( (daemon->shutdown) ||
       MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon) )
    return MHD_NO;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.8 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The code only reads the parameter and its pointee: it tests daemon->shutdown and passes daemon to MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_. There is no assignment to the parameter variable (daemon) itself, so the pointer is not modified. (Only if the MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ macro were to assign to its argument would a violation occur — based on the fragment shown no such modification happens.)
